attributes.action: Allow mosques, churches and places of worship to reopen.
attributes.additional_details: Religion and spirituality are cornerstones of social life for many in our mutlicultural nation. The Coronavirus lockdown measures have been difficult on everyone and we finally are starting to ease lockdown. This is a time for more prayer and spiritual connection, not less. It as a fundamental human right to establish and have functioning places of worship which has been abolished by governor Coronavirus measures. We want the government to restore this human right to it's citizenry.
attributes.background: We want the government to recognise the importance of congregational prayer and spiritual services to the many faith groups in the UK. Now that lockdown measures are easing, schools and other services are starting to open up we want places of worship to also reopen whilst following current measures.
